description: '''Matthew Jones''' (September 17, 1936 – March 30, 2011) was an African-American folk singer/songwriter known for being a [[field secretary]] of the [[Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee]]   and part of their [[The Freedom Singers]] in the 1960s. Jones was from [[Nashville, Tennessee]], but also worked as a school teacher in [[Macon, Georgia]]. He was arrested 20 times for this civil rights activism.
